issue.title: [BUG] preserve `pd-multiindex` index names, and ensure `TruncationTransformer.transform` output now has same columns as input

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: Fixes a known bug or removes unintended behavior

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Fixes #2998:
* ensures that `pd-multiindex` index is preserved in transformers and forecasters when converted to and back from a different internal panel type. This was an issue not specific to `TruncationTransformer`.
* `TruncationTransformer` `transform` output now has same columns as input. This was an issue specific to `TruncationTransformer`

body:
@mccrinbc-ss, odd that it didn't already do that. Must have been an oversight.
Fix here: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2999

Good to see there is a solution in the works, I will wait until it's merged to test it on my machine. Will this solution also keep the names of the multiindex (in my case, 'id' and 'time', rather than converting to 'instance' and 'timepoints')?

hm, it does indeed overwrite the index names!
That has to do with conversion and back-conversion between `pd-multiindex` and `nested-univ` (which the truncation transformer uses internally).
Fix doesn't include the issue with the index names yet, will look into this after the 0.13.0 release.
Now it does, this was a more general issue in the conversions, if the internal type did not have multiindex index names.

Hi I am still getting this exact error using /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/lib/python3.10/site-packages (from patsy>=0.5.2->statsmodels>=0.12.1->sktime) (1.16.0) This is what the dataframe looks like And this is what it looks like after

oh, it kills the *index*!

The column name issue has been resolved though.
Wait, its completely my fault :( I must of done a view of a copy as I split the data for training and test first, when I don't do that, the same code produces this: Apologies I never use pandas :(

issue.title: [ENH] test that `TruncationTransformer` preserves index and column names in `pd-multiindex`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Tests the failure case in https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/2998, where `TruncationTransformer` could destroy column and index names.

Also makes the `TruncationTransformer` safer by preserving index explicitly.

body:
yes, I just tested it and could not reproduce the bug.

But at least I wrote a test https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3535
either way, I think it would be nice to improve the truncation transformer to allow date time and loc indexing, thanks for reporting
